Whether you're a seasoned pool player or just looking for a relaxed night out, our venue promises an inviting space where the love for the game, great music, and the joy of friendship seamlessly come together.

name: Cheatham Street Warehouse
address: 119 Cheatham Street, San Marcos, TX 78666
about: There are very few music venues that have as much musical reverence and historical charm as Cheatham Street Warehouse. The place where George Strait, Randy Rogers, Stevie Ray Vaughan, Shelley King, John Arthur Martinez, Todd Snider, Slaid Cleaves, Terri Hendrix and many more honed their skills – Cheatham Street Warehouse is a music-lovers paradise.
amenities: Accepts Credit Cards,Divey,Casual,Loud,Good for Groups,Good For Dancing,Live Music,Beer & Wine Only,TV,No Outdoor Seating,Not Good For Kids,Bike Parking,Street Parking,Private Lot Parking
moreabout: From the time Kent Finlay and his business partner, Jim Cunningham, leased a creaky old warehouse along the railroad tracks in San Marcos, Texas, and opened Cheatham Street Warehouse in June 1974, the honky tonk seemed destined for fame in Texas music history. An Austin hippie country band, Freda (Marcia Ball) and the Firedogs played to an overflow crowd on an unbelievable opening night. As Kent’s brother, Steve, recalled, “At least five people behind the bar were selling beer as fast as we could open them. The beer box was soon depleted of cold beer and we kept icing down beer in an old bathtub behind the bar!”

name: Black Rabbit Saloon
address: 127 E. Hopkins Street, San Marcos, TX 78666
about: The latest and greatest addition to the San Marcos nightlife scene! Enjoy cold beer on draft, a great selection of bottled beer, or partake in one of our specialty cocktails. Offering San Marcos' only 'big kids' game room, you can roll Skeeball, throw darts, play pool, or be challenged at any of our numerous video games! Come drink, come play.
amenities: No Reservations,Accepts Credit Cards,Not Accepts Apple Pay,Casual,Very Loud,Good for Groups,Pool Table,Full Bar,TV,No Outdoor Seating,No Wi-Fi,No Smoking,Bike Parking
moreabout: Embark on an unforgettable nightlife experience at the newest sensation in San Marcos! Revel in the refreshing taste of cold beers on tap, a diverse array of bottled options, or indulge in the creativity of our specialty cocktails. Our venue boasts San Marcos' exclusive "big kids" game room, where the thrill of Skeeball, the precision of darts, the strategy of pool, and the excitement of various video games await your skill and enthusiasm. Whether you're looking for a casual night out or a lively challenge, our doors are open from Monday to Saturday, 5 pm to 2 am, and Sundays from 2 pm to 2 am. Come for the drinks, stay for the games, and let the vibrant energy of our establishment be the highlight of your San Marcos nights.

address: 801 Chestnut Street, San Marcos, TX 78666
about: Red Bus Food Park is home to the only 40-foot bus that is heated and cooled for dining with food trucks surrounding it. Opt for outside dining under the shade of the trees on the lot. Get a sweet dessert from the bakeshop on site.

The centerpiece of our culinary haven is the only 40-foot bus equipped with both heating and cooling systems, ensuring a cozy atmosphere for year-round enjoyment. Surrounding the bus, an array of food trucks awaits, offering a diverse range of delectable options to satisfy every palate. Choose to embrace the outdoors with al fresco dining under the comforting shade of trees scattered throughout the lot. And for those with a sweet tooth, a delightful finale awaits at our on-site bakeshop, ready to treat you to a heavenly dessert to complete your culinary journey at Red Bus Food Park.

name: Zelicks Icehouse
address: 336 W. Hopkins Street, San Marcos, TX 78666
about: Rough 'n' ready roadhouse bar set in a 1930s gas station with TVs, games, a pool table & a patio. In May 2011, Zelicks was opened by brothers' Chase and Seth Katz, as a place that would attract diverse clientele to its friendly atmosphere, making it the perfect place to make new friends or catch up with old ones.
amenities: No Reservations,Accepts Credit Cards,Not Accepts Android Pay,Not Accepts Apple Pay,Not Accepts Cryptocurrency,Outdoor Seating,Casual,Moderate Noise,Good for Groups,Pool Table,Private Lot Parking,Free Wi-Fi,Best nights on Tuesday, Friday, Saturday,Happy Hour Specials,Full Bar,Smoking Outside Only,Dogs Allowed,Wheelchair Accessible,TV,Open to All,Heated Outdoor Seating,Covered Outdoor Seating,Not Good For Dancing,Bike Parking
moreabout: Welcome to the best little icehouse in Texas. Come out and see what the "Mystery Keg" is every Friday. Experience this new, unique establishment to the San Marcos bar scene. In May 2011, Zelicks was opened by brothers, Chase and Seth Katz, bringing a new, unique establishment to the San Marcos bar scene. Chase and Seth had lived, studied, and worked in San Marcos for some time and opened Zelicks as a place that would attract diverse clientele to its friendly atmosphere, making it the perfect place to make new friends or catch up with old ones. The site itself was originally a 1930s gas station and still shows the remains of being so. Zelicks is full of interesting and original design features, including the old framed photos of the life of Jack Zelick Katz who is Seth and Chase's grandfather and the bar's namesake. Zelick was instrumental in the brothers' success as he provided their first-ever loan when opening their first business, Dos Gatos Kolache Bakery. After the success of the bakery, Chase and Seth chose to name the bar Zelicks as a tribute to their grandfather's faith and support in their entrepreneurial endeavors. The photos that line the walls of the bar show Zelick's life and the many places it has taken him - from its start in Lithuania, to Cape Town, Johannesburg, and finally, Toronto.

name: Middleton Brewing
address: 101 Oakwood Loop, San Marcos, TX 78666

Don't miss the opportunity to enhance your experience with a Public Brew House Tour every Saturday at 2 pm, gaining insights into the craft that makes Middleton Brewing a standout destination.

A sensory feast for both the eyes and ears, The Marc stands as a testament to a venue that must be seen and heard to be believed, promising an unforgettable encounter with the pinnacle of live entertainment.

The venue boasts the pinnacle of sound and light systems on both outdoor and indoor stages, ensuring that every note resonates with unparalleled clarity and intensity. Whether you're reveling in the expansive outdoor setting or seeking the more intimate vibe indoors, Ragnar's promises a sonic and visual feast that leaves you electrified and eager for an encore.

name: Riley's Tavern
address: 8894 FM 1102, New Braunfels, TX 78132
about: Did you know that Riley's was the first Texas establishment to get a beer license after prohibition ended in 1933? It's been a go-to watering hole ever since! Enjoy good food, great drinks, and of course, lots of wonderful live music.
amenities: No Reservations,Accepts Credit Cards,Not Accepts Android Pay,Not Accepts Apple Pay,Outdoor Seating,Divey, Casual,Very Loud,Good for Groups,Good For Dancing,Pool Table,Private Lot Parking,Juke Box,Live Music,Best nights on Friday, Saturday,Full Bar,Smoking Outside Only,TV,Not Good For Kids,No Wi-Fi,Bike Parking
moreabout: Step into a piece of Texas history at Riley's, a landmark that proudly holds the distinction of being the first establishment in the state to acquire a beer license after the end of prohibition in 1933. Since then, Riley's has etched itself into the fabric of the community as a timeless watering hole, offering a haven for those seeking good food, great drinks, and a generous dose of wonderful live music. The echoes of the past mingle with the lively present as patrons gather to enjoy the unique charm and enduring hospitality that define Riley's, making it a go-to destination where history and entertainment seamlessly converge.

name: Chances R
address: 138 S. LBJ Drive, San Marcos, TX 78666
about: We are Chances “R.” The oldest continuous liquor establishment in San Marcos. We started as Hutton’s Key club then the Angnew Club, L.O.’s, and The Restless Wind. It stayed the Restless Wind for fifty years and become Chances “R” in 2013. The current owners have had the Restless Wind – Chances “R” for forty seven years.
amenities: No Reservations,Accepts Credit Cards,Divey,Moderate Noise,Good for Groups,Pool Table,Full Bar,TV,No Outdoor Seating,Not Good For Dancing,No Wi-Fi,Bike Parking
moreabout: Welcome to Chances "R," a legendary establishment that stands as the oldest continuous liquor haven in San Marcos, boasting a rich history that spans several iconic transformations. It began its journey as Hutton's Key club, evolving through the Angnew Club, L.O.'s, and a fifty-year tenure as The Restless Wind. In 2013, it metamorphosed into Chances "R," marking yet another chapter in its storied existence. The enduring legacy is underscored by the current owners who have held the reins of The Restless Wind – now Chances "R" – for an impressive forty-seven years. As you step into this venerable space, you not only enter a bar but a living testament to the vibrant history of San Marcos' nightlife, where each name change represents a chapter in the city's evolving social tapestry.

The Green Parrot is more than just a watering hole; it's a testament to the enduring spirit of camaraderie and the ability to handle liquor with flair. name: Kissing Alley
address: 121 E. Hopkins Street, San Marcos, TX 78666
about: What may seem like an average alley to passersby is actually one of San Marcos’ hidden gems! With eclectic murals both large and small, twinkly lights strung overhead and, of course, scenic views of the Hays County Courthouse – Kissing Alley is the heart of Downtown San Marcos.
moreabout: Discover the enchanting allure of Kissing Alley, a hidden gem in the heart of Downtown San Marcos that transforms what may seem like an ordinary alley into a vibrant treasure trove. As passersby navigate through this seemingly average passage, they are greeted by eclectic murals, both grand and intricate, adorning the walls. Overhead, twinkly lights create a magical ambiance, casting a warm glow that enhances the charm of this unique space. Beyond its artistic allure, Kissing Alley offers scenic views of the Hays County Courthouse, providing a picturesque backdrop to the vibrant energy of Downtown San Marcos. Unveiling the artistic and scenic beauty that lies within, Kissing Alley stands as a testament to the unexpected treasures waiting to be explored in this dynamic cityscape.

name: Roughhouse Brewing
address: 680 Oakwood Loop, San Marcos, TX 78666
about: Roughhouse Brewing is a family-owned and operated craft brewery located on five acres of the Pasternak family ranch in the hill country of San Marcos. Tucked away off of Ranch Road 12, the brewery serves refreshing, farmhouse-style beer and scratch-made fare that complements the Texas landscape. Customers can relax inside the rustic brewery barn or in the oak-surrounded outdoor seating area and enjoy live music on the weekends.

Located off the beaten path on Ranch Road 12, this craft brewery offers a unique experience with refreshing, farmhouse-style beers and scratch-made fare that seamlessly blends with the surroundings. Whether patrons choose to unwind inside the rustic brewery barn or opt for the oak-surrounded outdoor seating area, the ambiance is one of tranquility and warmth. To enhance the experience, live music graces the weekends, making Roughhouse Brewing not just a brewery but a haven where the essence of family, craft, and the Texas hill country converge.

name: The Vault
address: 100 W. Hopkins Street, San Marcos, TX 78666
about: The Vault is a popular nightlife spot on the Square in Downtown San Marcos. The name pays homage to when the building was the "Old State Bank" and the vault inside was blown up with nitro by the Newton Gang, waking up the neighborhood. The gang emerged with $24,000 and they simply walked out of town.
amenities: Accepts Credit Cards,Very Loud,Good for Groups,Street Parking,Full Bar,TV,No Outdoor Seating,Bike Parking
moreabout: Step into history and entertainment at The Vault, a vibrant nightlife destination situated on the Square in Downtown San Marcos. The name itself holds a captivating story, paying homage to the building's past life as the "Old State Bank." It was in these walls that the notorious Newton Gang, in an audacious feat, used nitro to blow open the vault, creating a spectacle that reverberated through the neighborhood. The gang's bold heist saw them emerge with $24,000, a daring act that concluded with them calmly walking out of town. Today, The Vault encapsulates the spirit of this historic event, offering patrons an immersive experience where the echoes of the past mingle with the lively atmosphere of contemporary nightlife, creating a truly unique and memorable visit to Downtown San Marcos.
